examples: The agreement followed months of negotiation.
The agreement came after several hours of negotiations.
The negotiations between the two countries finally yielded a peace agreement.
The agreement is part of efforts to bring peace to the region.
She nodded in agreement with his statement.
words.defineEn: a promise, an arrangement, or a contract between two or more people
words.defineVi: một lời hứa, một sự sắp xếp, hoặc một hợp đồng giữa hai hoặc nhiều người

examples: A little sympathy makes a world of difference to someone who's been badly treated.
Jack was struggling and found comfort in venting his problems to his brother Joe, looking for sympathy and validation.
The actor's grimace of pain was so convincing that the audience winced in sympathy.
We poured in our sympathy.
I have some sympathy for them.
words.defineEn: feelings of care and understanding toward other people's emotions, especially sadness or suffering
words.defineVi: cảm giác quan tâm và thấu hiểu cảm xúc của người khác, đặc biệt là nỗi buồn hoặc đau khổ

examples: Her work has given pleasure to millions of readers.
She takes pleasure in her work.
The books in the library are available for checkout at their pleasure.
The murderer was imprisoned at His Majesty's pleasure.
I'm just going to find pleasure in perfect little moments like this.
words.defineEn: a feeling of great enjoyment and happiness
words.defineVi: một cảm giác vô cùng thích thú và hạnh phúc

examples: They still have some surprises up their sleeves.
As a loving husband, he surprises his wife with romantic gestures on special occasions.
They were surprised by the unique taste of burdock chips, a healthier alternative to regular potato chips.
I planned a surprise party for my little sister's birthday.
He surprised his guests at a dinner party by presenting a unique dessert twist on cheese fondue.
words.defineEn: a mild feeling of shock we have when something unusual happens
words.defineVi: một cảm giác sốc nhẹ mà chúng ta có khi có điều gì đó bất thường xảy ra

examples: Danish Blue cheese is fantastic in vegetarian dishes.
The vibrant hue of damson makes it a fantastic ingredient for homemade fruit popsicles.
Take time by the forelock and accept that fantastic internship!
She told me that yeast extract is a fantastic seasoning substitute for reducing sodium in my meals.
All my friends agree that Gruyère is a fantastic melting cheese.
words.defineEn: extremely amazing and great
words.defineVi: cực kỳ tuyệt vời và tuyệt vời

examples: Your presentation sounded great, honestly.
The finance minister's fall from grace gave his enemies great satisfaction.
To show great courage.
The pope himself had taken great umbrage at the book.
The baby has brought them great joy.
words.defineEn: worthy of being approved or admired
words.defineVi: xứng đáng được chấp thuận hoặc ngưỡng mộ

examples: Congratulations, Rhett, you get to hug Zach Braff!
Where am I? - Congratulations.
I almost bid against myself twice. - Congratulations, Link. -
- Congratulations, I was running a secret investigation to smoke out the rat in this unit, and you just blew my cover.
And we're gonna sign that thing and send you a GMM poster and mug! - Congratulations! - (laughs) Woohoo!
words.defineEn: an expression of joy or approval offered to someone to acknowledge their achievement, success, or good fortune
words.defineVi: một biểu hiện của niềm vui hoặc sự chấp thuận dành cho ai đó để thừa nhận thành tích, thành công hoặc may mắn của họ

words.defineEn: beneficial or advantageous to someone's health, well-being, or overall welfare
words.defineVi: có lợi hoặc có lợi cho sức khỏe, hạnh phúc hoặc phúc lợi tổng thể của ai đó

examples: There's a lovely park right on our doorstep.
She was a lovely woman and my mother truly enjoyed her company.
I have been as busy as a beaver these last few weeks crocheting up custom orders for some lovely customers.
They’ve let that lovely old house fall to pieces around them.
The rose was pink and had a lovely scent.
words.defineEn: very beautiful or attractive
words.defineVi: rất đẹp hoặc hấp dẫn

examples: He's just brilliant.
Three cheers for Sarah, whose brilliant goal at the last minute won us the game!
That was a brilliant pass by Holden.
It's a brilliant place for hearing about jobs through the grapevine.
He had a nose for trouble and a brilliant tactical mind.
words.defineEn: extremely clever, talented, or impressive
words.defineVi: cực kỳ thông minh, tài năng, hoặc ấn tượng

examples: I absolutely love your shoes.
The cranberry pie at the bakery is absolutely delicious, especially with a scoop of vanilla ice cream.
Jenny is absolutely cheesed off with her job.
He was said to be absolutely shattered after losing his job.
Those of you with clear consciences have absolutely nothing to fear.
words.defineEn: used to put an emphasis on a statement
words.defineVi: được sử dụng để nhấn mạnh vào một tuyên bố

examples: Of course there is some truth in all this, but only up to a point.
Of course we're not going to sell the house!
Of course I'll be there - with bells on!
Of course we'll change it for a larger size, Madam.
Of course, I suppose 20 years does make a lot of difference.
words.defineEn: used to give permission or express agreement
words.defineVi: được sử dụng để cho phép hoặc bày tỏ sự đồng ý

examples: For the first offence I was given a fine.
There's a fine line between humour and inappropriateness.
Our fine traditions give us a head start on the competition.
Farah ran a fine race to take the gold medal.
If he wants to play a game of cat and mouse, fine, I'll play.
words.defineEn: meeting the minimum or expected level of quality, but not necessarily exceeding it
words.defineVi: đáp ứng mức chất lượng tối thiểu hoặc dự kiến, nhưng không nhất thiết phải vượt quá mức đó

examples: My best friend's pink hair definitely raised a few eyebrows at our very strict school.
I definitely felt the importance of the occasion.
You should definitely bake a brie with cranberry sauce.
Speaking that rudely to your teacher definitely crosses the line.
Going to the beach is definitely my scene.
words.defineEn: in a certain or definite way
words.defineVi: theo một cách nhất định hoặc xác định

words.defineEn: used to agree to a suggestion or criticism
words.defineVi: được sử dụng để đồng ý với một gợi ý hoặc lời chỉ trích

examples: OK, mum's the word!
OK, it’s a deal.
Ok, we can have pasta for dinner tonight.
OK, I'll do it -
OK, what happened at Blair's party last night?
words.defineEn: said to show that we are agreeing to do something or we agree with something
words.defineVi: nói để thể hiện rằng chúng tôi đang đồng ý làm điều gì đó hoặc chúng tôi đồng ý với điều gì đó

examples: The paneer curry smells amazing!
It’s amazing.
My mom is an amazing cook.
It is amazing really.
That's amazing Ralph.
words.defineEn: extremely surprising, particularly in a good way
words.defineVi: cực kỳ ngạc nhiên, đặc biệt là trong một cách tốt

examples: The report names and shames companies that are not doing enough to fight industrial pollution.
Pardon my French, but that's a damned shame!
The teacher encouraged their students to tell the truth and shame the devil, even if it meant admitting to cheating or plagiarism.
Look, I'm just as upset as anyone, but I'm not willing to take part in some name and shame against everyone in the neighborhood!
The time limit is shame.
words.defineEn: an uneasy feeling that we get because of our own or someone else's mistake or bad manner
words.defineVi: một cảm giác khó chịu mà chúng ta có được do sai lầm hoặc cách cư xử tồi tệ của chính mình hoặc của người khác

examples: She said an awful lot
The incident says an awful lot about his character.
It's awful having a boss who breathes down your neck all the time.
I told you that you'd feel awful if you drank that much wine.
He couldn't help but grimace when he saw the awful outfit his friend was wearing.
words.defineEn: extremely unpleasant, bad, or disagreeable
words.defineVi: cực kỳ khó chịu, xấu, hoặc khó chịu

examples: The old couple took pity on him and gave him food.
For pity's sake, help me!
I took pity on the stray cat and fed him.
We took pity on a couple of people waiting in the rain for a bus and gave them a lift.
The woman's heart was filled with pity for the orphaned children, and as she spent time with them, she realized that pity is akin to love, and she became devoted to them.
words.defineEn: a feeling of sadness caused by the suffering of others
words.defineVi: một cảm giác buồn bã gây ra bởi sự đau khổ của người khác
